Odom's ML debut (and only career game)

ej,oneis101,P,ormsr901,HBP call Ump Ormsby ruled it brushed Rice's uniform.  Pitcher O'Neill rather strenuously voiced his disagreement, claiming Rice made no attempt to get out of the way of the slow pitch. O'Neill was ejected, and Mgr Huggins rushed out to resume the argument, but was not ejected

Dugan's snap throw to Johnson at 1B appeared to catch Bluege as he rounded the bag, but Ump McGowan called him safe. There was a two minute delay while the Yankees protested the call.  Johnson was sure he tagged him out.

$Mgr Huggins rushed out and registered a violent protest that there had been a mistake in the WS1 batting order.  At the beginning of this inning, Johnson had been in street clothes, but when WS1 ran out of right-handed batters, he went into the dressing room and emerged in Senator attire. Johnson strode to the plate cool and smiling as if pinch- hitting with the bases full was something he had been doing all his life.

Before the opening pitch, Yankees' shortstop Everett Scott was honoured as playing in his 1,300th consecutive game. 'Scottie' was remembered by his home folk in Indiana by a finely polished bowling ball and new pair of bowling shoes.
High throw to Judge, pulling him off the bag

Running, leaping 1-handed catch; fans gave Combs 'a rear admiral salute'.
Texas Leaguer; wild throw past the plate
To the garden wall in LCF
Darkness loomed towards end of game; very difficult to see, and no one could follow Marberry's pitches.
Goslin was nearly at 2B when Miller caught it but made it back to 1B when Poole couldn't hold Miller's throw.

Collins purposely let Johnson's easy fly drop in; some believe it was to make Walter run the bases in the heat. Fans booed Collins for the rest of the game.

$Morning rain made OF grass sodden but the diamond was kept dry by a big oilskin 'bedspread'.  Some damp spots on the base lines were repaired by several wheelbarrow loads of sand hastily dumped by the grounds keepers. Ruth got a great hand as he came to bat
Game was delayed 10 minutes somewhere in the 1st inning to make repairs to the pitching rubber.

Mgr Bucky Harris didn't like the way Goslin played the two triples to LF and replaced him.  The two argued heatedly. Goslin was fined $100 and suspended indefinitely after the game.
Force attempt at 2B was late; Harris' relay to 1B pulled Judge off the bag but Ump Ormsby ruled out.  The A's surged around Ormsby and Hildebrand to protest.

Game was called due to darkness and ruled a tie
The ball rolled into a hole beneath a gate and Falk tried to get it out.  Mgr Collins protested it should've been a double.  Ump Connolly inspected the premises and let the triple stand.
Tate ran Barrett back almost all the way to 2B before throwing to Adams.
The WS1 home crowd was actually rooting for Lyons to get Veach out for a no-hitter.
